snippet: Many of the Syrian government’s most powerful weapons are looking less potent and in some cases like a liability for the military of President Bashar al-Assad.
abstract: Military analysis; many of the Syrian government’s most powerful weapons, now with diplomatic efforts dead and the future of country playing out on the battlefield, are looking less potent and in some cases like a liability for the military of Pres Bashar al-Assad; rebels have turned part of his formidable arsenal on his own troops, and his military is more equipped to do major battle with a foreign enemy rather than a protracted civil conflict with his own people.

byline.contributor: Damien Cave and Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon.

lead_paragraph: Many of the Syrian government’s most powerful weapons are looking less potent and in some cases like a liability for the military of President Bashar al-Assad.

headline.seo: As Conflict Continues in Syria, Assad’s Arms Face Strain
headline.main: Syrian Leader’s Arms Under Strain as Conflict Continues

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
